name: (2,2-dibromoethenyl)benzene
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4246
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base has a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius. The bromine atoms increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. Each bromine is estimated to add approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces.
